title: Africa Sustainable Livestock 2050: Biosafety and Public Health Practices in Poultry Farming in Kenya

tasks.task: Meet Winnie Wangoi, a poultry farmer.
subtasks: Inquire about her involvement with FAO's project.
Listen to her accounts of attending FAO seminars.
Understand the project's aim to safeguard public health and reduce zoonotic diseases.
Learn about the checklist developed for biosecurity practices.
Discuss the role of local veterinary services in the project.
Note the impact of training on reducing mortality and improving slaughter weight.
Address the importance of separating clean and dirty areas.
Explain the process of separating feathers and carcasses.
Highlight the significance of getting a certification through training.

tasks.task: Address legislative gaps in the poultry value chain.
subtasks: Acknowledge existing laws but recognize implementation challenges.
Explore the need for improved enforcement and adherence to procedures.
Consider the benefits to businesses through better practices.
Reflect on the role of community engagement and support.
Discuss the use of tools and resources for better practices.
